sentences.english: However, all the figures have yet to come home braving persons.
sentences.chinese: 然而，所有的数字家园掘金者至今尚未如愿以偿。

sentences.english: Twelve years later, she did, becoming the boxer’s fourth wife.
sentences.chinese: 十二年后，她果真如愿成为拳王的第四任妻子。

sentences.english: A wealthy man fruitfully married a beautiful female movie star.
sentences.chinese: 一名富翁如愿以偿地娶到了一位美丽的女影星。

sentences.english: When the gods wish to punish us, we must first make our prayers.
sentences.chinese: 若诸神要惩罚我等，必先让我等如愿以偿。

sentences.english: But it is not distributed as they would like.
sentences.chinese: 但是其分配方式未能如愿以偿。

sentences.english: The legs of the clitoris flare out somewhat like the wish bone of a chicken.
sentences.chinese: 分展而开的阴蒂脚有些像鸡胸上叉状的如愿骨。

sentences.english: Fear is the one main reason that holds us back from getting what we want.
sentences.chinese: 畏惧感是阻碍我们如愿以偿的主要原因。

sentences.english: Wishing upon a wishbone is an ancient custom.
sentences.chinese: 向如愿骨许愿是一项古老的习俗。

sentences.english: After the university graduates, emerald green flower achieves what one wishes marry Chen Zhi.
sentences.chinese: 大学毕业后，翠花如愿以偿的嫁给陈志。

sentences.english: The couple finally married last month in Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 上个月，这对情侣终于如愿以偿在爱丁堡举行婚礼。

sentences.english: If we canwoult do as we would, we must do as we can.
sentences.chinese: 如不能如愿而行，定须尽力而为。

sentences.english: If she wishes to insinuate go-between of " meaning " , get disappointment however and answer.
sentences.chinese: 她如愿巴结“意”中人，却落得失望而回。

sentences.english: Well the woman almost got her wish.
sentences.chinese: 这回她总算是如愿以偿了。

sentences.english: If we can't do as we would, we must do as we can.
sentences.chinese: 如没有能如愿而止，定须勉力而为。

sentences.english: Today, I finally achieved what I wished and arrived at Dabancheng.
sentences.chinese: 初夏里的一天，我终于如愿以偿，来到达坂城。

sentences.english: Whether they can and got a large number of gold then?
sentences.chinese: 他们是否能如愿以偿地得到大批的黄金呢？

definition: things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to miss narrowly/to let a great opportunity slip
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
to settle for second best/the next best thing
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
to pass a university entrance exam
to want to/to feel like/to fancy/to care for sb/desirous of
